title: Devices
description: Manage devices enrolled in Cloudflare for Teams.

links.title: List Devices

limit.description: The number of keys to return. The cursor attribute may be used to iterate over the next batch of keys if there are more than the limit.

cursor.description: Opaque token indicating the position from which to continue when requesting the next set of records if the amount of list results was limited by the limit parameter. A valid value for the cursor can be obtained from the cursors object in the result_info structure.

start_date.description: The earliest date used to find devices whose last_seen field falls within that date range.

end_date.description: The latest date used to find devices whose last_seen field falls within that date range.

order_by.description: The device field to order by.

direction.description: The direction to sort device results.

userName.description: The device user's name as defined by the configured Access IDP.

email.description: The contact email address of the user.

match.description: Return results matching any or all of the provided search parameters.

links.title: List Admin Override code for device
links.description: Fetch one-time use admin override code for a device. This relies on the Admin Override setting being enabled in your device configuration.

links.title: Set Local Domain Fallback List
links.description: Set the list of domains resolved locally by WARP clients
links.curl:
curl -X PUT "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/accounts/699d98642c564d2e855e9661899b7252/devices/policy/fallback_domains" \
     -H "X-Auth-Email: user@example.com" \
     -H "X-Auth-Key: c2547eb745079dac9320b638f5e225cf483cc5cfdda41" \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
     --data '[{"suffix":"example.com","description":"Domain bypass for local development","dns_server":"['192.168.0.1', '10.1.1.1']"}]'

suffix.description: The domain suffix to match when resolving locally.

description.description: A description of the fallback domain, displayed in the client UI

dns_server.description: A list of IP addresses to handle domain resolution.

links.title: Get Local Domain Fallback List
links.description: Get the list of domains resolved locally by WARP clients

links.title: Set Split Tunnel Exclude List
links.description: Set the list of routes excluded from the WARP client's tunnel
links.curl:
curl -X PUT "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/accounts/699d98642c564d2e855e9661899b7252/devices/policy/exclude" \
     -H "X-Auth-Email: user@example.com" \
     -H "X-Auth-Key: c2547eb745079dac9320b638f5e225cf483cc5cfdda41" \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
     --data '[{"address":"192.0.2.0/24","description":"Exclude testing domains from the tunnel"}]'

address.description: The address in CIDR format to exclude from the tunnel. If address is present, host must not be present.

description.description: A description of the split tunnel item, displayed in the client UI.

host.description: The domain name to exclude from the tunnel. If host is present, address must not be present.

links.title: Get Split Tunnel Exclude List
links.description: Get the list of routes excluded from the WARP client's tunnel

links.title: Set Split Tunnel Include List
links.description: Set the list of routes included in the WARP client's tunnel
links.curl:
curl -X PUT "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/accounts/699d98642c564d2e855e9661899b7252/devices/policy/include" \
     -H "X-Auth-Email: user@example.com" \
     -H "X-Auth-Key: c2547eb745079dac9320b638f5e225cf483cc5cfdda41" \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
     --data '[{"address":"192.0.2.0/24","description":"Include testing domains from the tunnel"}]'

address.description: The address in CIDR format to include in the tunnel. If address is present, host must not be present.

description.description: A description of the split tunnel item, displayed in the client UI

host.description: The domain name to include in the tunnel. If host is present, address must not be present.

links.title: Get Split Tunnel Include List
links.description: Get the list of routes included in the WARP client's tunnel

email.description: The contact email address of the user.

deleted.description: True if the device was deleted

last_seen.description: When the device last connected to Cloudflare services.
